Key Match Events: Jofra Archer led the attack with three wickets for 23 runs on his return from injury.
Jason Roy scored 49 runs at the top of the order for England.
England restricted India to 124 for seven in the first innings.
Mark Wood took out Shikhar Dhawan's leg stump at 92mph.
Rishabh Pant hit a reverse-scooped six against Jofra Archer.
Shreyas Iyer scored a measured 67 runs, hitting eight fours and one six.
Chris Jordan closed out the innings, taking Shreyas Iyer's wicket with a fine catch from Dawid Malan.
Jonny Bairstow and Dawid Malan finished the match with a handful of sixes, including Malan's winning blow.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of a bumper crowd of 67,200, one of the biggest congregations since the Covid-19 pandemic struck.
England captain Eoin Morgan left Moeen Ali out of the XI and handed Adil Rashid his first ever new ball stint in the format.
